text: hello my needle drops Anthony Fantino
here going to talk about this album dark
night of the soul dark night of the soul
is a musical collaboration between
producer Danger Mouse and Sparklehorse
which was the creative musical outlet
for singer-songwriter and
multi-instrumentalist Marc Linkous it's
just been officially released this month
and it's pretty much the release that it
deserved last year when it was
originally bumping around the internet
getting a lot of hype getting a lot of
reviews and gathering a lot of buzz
which is to be completely honest why I
find it difficult to review this album
this is one of the few moments I sort of
let this happen but the situation
surrounding this release makes me see
red blind with anger it's one of these
moments where I see the old way of doing
things in regards to marketing promoting
and selling music just destroying the
creative process destroying the link the
bond the pathway of communication
between artists and fans I guess to put
things very bluntly I am really upset
that this album had to be released after
the death of Marc Linkous of course we
all know that Marc Linkous died by
suicide and there would be no possible
way that Columbia and EMI would have
known that this was coming
Plus according to New Musical Express
early this year while Marc Linkous was
still alive there was talk about dark
night of the soul actually getting a
release but just talk now there's a lot
of speculation as to why this release
was halted the New York Times cited that
it was most likely differences between
Lex Records and EMI Lex Records being
the label that Danger Mouse was signed
to at the time still signed to I'm sure
whatever the issue was this
was an example of a major label standing
in front of what is clearly great art I
didn't love every song on this album but
a lot of them are really freaking good
this is just one more instance of
copyright and intellectual property
keeping musicians from sharing their
music with their fans how and whenever
they want to and this isn't a
recommendation or a way that you should
feel but merely a statement of my
feelings but I'm not sure I feel
comfortable spending money on an album
that will improve the bottom line of a
record company that stood in the way of
its release in the first place
